alert.note: Alert for Anoka; Hennepin (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 14 at 11:16AM CDT until further notice by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Minnesota... Minnesota River At New Ulm affecting Blue Earth, Nicollet and Brown Counties. ...Forecast flooding changed from Moderate to Major severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Minnesota... Mississippi River AT Hwy 610 @ Brooklyn Pk affecting Hennepin and Anoka Counties. ...Forecast flooding changed from Moderate to Major severity for the following rivers in Minnesota... Minnesota River At Morton affecting Renville and Redwood Counties. .The combination of snow melt runoff and forecast rainfall will continue to cause flooding through the next week or so. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississippi River AT Hwy 610 @ Brooklyn Pk. * WHEN...From late tonight until further notice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1000 AM CDT Friday, the stage was 10.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tonight and continue rising to a crest of 16.5 feet early Wednesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.4 feet on 04/09/1997. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
